fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-539].
  {panel}

I'm not 100% sure on the answer to this myself, but initially when I created this KB Space, I expected that the search, label and activity macros would all be filtering at the space level by default.

I think it depends on what we think will be more prevalent:
* People will create one or just a few silo'd KB spaces in an instance with lots of other team, project etc spaces = Should default to restricting them to this space
* People will have instances just full of KB spaces = Should default to side wide

I feel like it's that first option is going to be the most prevalent?
fields.summary: Should the KB Homepage macros be restricted to that space by default?

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-538].
  {panel}

*Process:*
# Install Service Desk
# Associate projects
# Create issues
# Disable Service Desk (Kills all issue access)
# Uninstall Service Desk (through add-on option)
# Spend countless hours removing schemes, workflows, roles, etc. from Jira
# Still finding remnants of Service Desk (tables, etc.)

{quote}*If you have a "uninstall" function, that function should TRULY uninstall all parts of that plugin as though it was never there.*{quote}
fields.summary: Service Desk does not completely uninstall all configurations pertaining to service desk.

fields.description:
Unable to Find Project when Project Key is using Number

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# go to _Administration > System > General Configuration_ and click on Advance Settings.
# change *jira.projectkey.pattern* to:
{code} ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+) {code}
# Create a new service desk project in _Service Desk > Create a Service Desk_.
# set the project name and project key to *R2D2*.
# click the 'Cutomer Portal' tab, then click on 'View the Customer Portal'.
# log out from service desk, it will still on the Customer Portal Login page.
# copy the URL of the page. For example:
{code} http://localhost:8625/servicedesk/customer/r2d2/user/login?destination=r2d2 {code}
# open a new browser window/tab and paste the URL.

*Expected Results:*
The R2D2 Service Desk Customer Portal login page will appears.

*Actual Results:*
The following message appears in the page:
{code} The Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist. {code}

*Notes:*
* After the URL being paste and go, the URL changes to:
{code} http://localhost:8625/servicedesk/customer/r/user/login?destination=r2d2%2Fuser%2Flogin {code}
* Using another way of entering the customer portal URL like below, will throw the same message.
{code} http://localhost:8625/servicedesk/customer/r2d2 {code}
* As based on this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format], *R2D2* is supported.
fields.summary: Unable to Find Project when Project Key have a Number

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*:
# Create a new Service Desk using Cyrillic symbols name
# Navigate to *Customer Portal* and add a new Group using a Cyrillic symbol name as the group name (for instance use {{тест}})
# Go to _View Customer Portal_, and create a Customer Request in the Group that was created earlier.
# Click on the *Create* button

*Expected Behavior*:
The request is created

*Actual Result*:
The request is not created and no Error appears in the logs nor the UI.

Problem is reproducible on IE8 and IE9.
fields.summary: Using Cyrillic symbols as the Service Desk Name along with the Group name (being Cyrillic), prevents the user from creating Customer Requests in that Request type in IE8 & IE9

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-524].
  {panel}

Sometimes it's possible (due to a project) that you need a new request type only for a few weeks. 

When you delete a request type the message says:
{quote}Are you sure you want to delete the *Get access to a printer* request type?
Issues created with this request type won't be affected.{quote}

This note is not correct. When you remove a request type then the following happens within the customer portal:
* the request type icon switches (random or everytime the robot?)
* all details which are entered fields within the create event are not visible to the customer portal

It would great to have the ability to archive those request types which are not needed anymore and no customer can choose this again or you can re-enable it if needed.
fields.summary: Archiving of request types

h4.Steps to reproduce:

# Access unanimously http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo3

h4.Result
http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo/user/login?destination=coo3

http://localhost:8623/servicedesk/customer/coo3/user/login?destination=coo3

(!) notice the ..customer/coo instead of ../customer/coo3 

This causes the portal can't be found with *The Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist.* message.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Service Desk request
# Type up a comment and add a large attachment 
# Submit comment before attachment finishes uploading

Expected:

Page should wait till upload is completed (the way it does on request creation)

Actual:

Comment is added and the attachment upload is canceled

(i) I used Charles's throttling functionality to test this

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 28 Jan 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

This suggestion is considered a potential addition to our longer-term roadmap. We'll typically review this request in about 12 months time, at which point we’ll consider whether we need to alter its status.

For the nearest future we've decided to prioritise other areas of the Jira Service Management roadmap.

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can read more about our [approach to highly voted suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117], and [how we prioritise what to implement here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].

To learn more about our recent investments in Jira Service Management and Data Center, please check our [public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/data-center?status=shipped&] and our two dashboards containing [recently resolved issues|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94990], and [current work and future plans|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=94991].

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 9th May 2018}
{panel}
Thank you everyone who has voted or commented on this suggestion. Apologies for allowing this issue to remain open for a period of time without a clear update.

We've assessed this request and how it may positively impact our broad enterprise customer base. After initial analysis we have decided that we may not include this in our short-medium term roadmap. However, we’re not closing the ticket at this time in order to garner broader interest for this feature. I understand this may seem disappointing, but we believe it’s important for us to be open, transparent and honest with our customers.

In the mean time we’ve been busy and have recently released Priorities per project, Approval visibility and also addressed the #1 JAC issue of disabling account verification emails.

We will definitely post an update if we prioritize this feature earlier.

Thank you for your support.

— Jira Service Desk Team

 
----
Currently it is not possible to use create a subdomain, f.e support.example.com and link this subdomain to the service desk url [https://www.example.com/jira/servicedesk/customer/key].
h3. Workaround

Use a Reverse Proxy or URL redirect service external from JIRA.

Another workaround is described in [How to customize customer portal URL in JIRA Service Desk Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-customize-customer-portal-url-in-jira-service-desk-server-847755218.html]
 * _Please ensure you test this first on your test instance before you implement on your production._
 * _Please also note that Atlassian does not support this customization._
fields.summary: Make it possible to use service desk in combination with subdomains

fields.description:
Customers are not directed to Service Desk. Customers need JIRA access to go to Service Desk. 
bq. Currently there's no way to force users to use the Customer Portal - they can still create issues normally.

**This a reoccurrence of a previous bug.
fields.summary: Using the default Service Desk Permissions doesn't direct customers to Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a JIRA Admin creates a Service Desk project and then decides to delete the project.
The admin is then unable to create a new Service Desk project that has the same name and key, even though the project is created in JIRA.
if the admin creates a project with the same name and key and then try to enable Service Desk on the project, it will not enable it.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Service Desk Project. 
name: Test
key: TES
# Confirm that the project Exists on ServiceDesk module, and in JIRA.
# Delete the project.
# Try to create a new Project with the same name or key.
# The project will be created on JIRA but the ServiceDesk can't be enable.

h3. Expected Behaviour:
The Admin should be able to create the Service Desk after deleting.
fields.summary: Project key / name of a deleted project can't be used in ServiceDesk.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-509].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour

When you add a comment to a JIRA ticket through a Service Desk project, everyone can see said comment and you can only restrict it's security level after the comment has been made.

h3. Expected Behaviour

I'd like to have the option to change what the default behaviour to handle the security level for issue comments on a Service Desk project.
fields.summary: Improve Service Desk's comment security level

fields.description:
We have a performance problem around the loading of the "request type list" on the customer portal.

If you have a slow (-ish) database and say > 50 request types defined then it can take too long to render.

This is caused because the requet type loading code is too eager.  It loads all the request types for a portal AND the form and fields and field values for that request type.  Its doing this in a loop per request type.

{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,603 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT f."ID" AS "AO_54307E_GROUP__aointernal__id",t."ID" AS "AO_54307E_GROUPTOREQUESTTYPE__aointernal__id",f."VIEWPORT_ID",f."GROUP_NAME" FROM public."AO_54307E_GROUPTOREQUESTTYPE" t INNER JOIN public."AO_54307E_GROUP" f ON t."GROUP_ID" = f."ID" WHERE t."REQUEST_TYPE_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,627 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" WHERE "FORM_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,742 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,764 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,785 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,866 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT f."ID" AS "AO_54307E_GROUP__aointernal__id",t."ID" AS "AO_54307E_GROUPTOREQUESTTYPE__aointernal__id",f."VIEWPORT_ID",f."GROUP_NAME" FROM public."AO_54307E_GROUPTOREQUESTTYPE" t INNER JOIN public."AO_54307E_GROUP" f ON t."GROUP_ID" = f."ID" WHERE t."REQUEST_TYPE_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:29,902 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" WHERE "FORM_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:30,045 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:30,066 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2014-05-06 09:36:30,086 http-bio-2990-exec-13 DEBUG admin 574x14649x1 1xd7qel 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/7 [net.java.ao.sql] SELECT * FROM public."AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = ?
{noformat}

We need to improve the access path so that we only loads the request type high level details so that "request type list" page remains snappy.

*Workaround:*
* Dramatically reduce the number of the request type < 30
* Put the request type into category so it does not load at the same time.
fields.summary: The Request Type landing page is too eager - its loads all fields and forms when they are not needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-494].
{panel}
Today when you change SLA configuration it can have dramatic effects about what SLA's are running or not.

For general support reasons we should have a "history audit" of the SLA configurations that are in place at a given point in time.

This would be all the configuration and when it applied.

This could then be used by admins and atlassian support to debug how the configuration has changed and how it should be applied to current and past issues.

Also we could have an issue history record that says WHEN an given SLA configuration was being applied to an issue and when new ones are overriding it (eg when we drop an SLA timer because of a config change)

This would also help for support reasons.
fields.summary: Service needs an SLA configuration audit trail and a issue history of the SLA config that was in play

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Replicate
# Create a Service Desk request.
# Add an image using the wiki markup. E.g.:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
!http://link-to-my-image/image.jpeg!
{noformat}

h4. Expected Behavior
* The image would be displayed in its full size
* Stipulating it's width would cause the image to resize accordingly
* Or the image would be automatically displayed as a thumbnail with a lightbox to show the full image

h4. Actual Behavior
The image is added as a thumbnail, but it's impossible to view it's full size through the Service Desk request.

h5. Workaround
Right-click the image and choose to view the image in a new tab.
fields.summary: Image size is not correct on Customer View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with valid email
# Create a Service Desk with administrator
# Go to the People tab and remove jira-users from the Service Desk Team
# Login as the user(Service Desk Customer)
# File a Service Desk request
# When you receive the notification as the Service Desk Customer, reply directly to the notification with any comment

h4. Expected Behaviour:
Mail handler should process that email and comment in that issue

h4. Actual Behaviour:
Comment not added for the Service Desk customer

In Debug incoming log:
{code}
2014-04-25 23:28:03,542 DEBUG [testing] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    mail capture S: +OK message follows
2014-04-25 23:28:03,715 DEBUG [testing] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    mail capture User 'vicky' does not have permission to comment on an issue in project '10200'.
2014-04-25 23:28:03,717 DEBUG [testing] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    mail capture Deleting Message: <CABuj-xkVgBSwF5PGN9L9VVBBwgnktmYEyMbiUgA_h9Nq9dMTMQ@mail.gmail.com>
2014-04-25 23:28:03,717 DEBUG [testing] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    mail capture Closing folder
2014-04-25 23:28:03,741 DEBUG [testing] QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ServiceRunner    mail capture Delivered-To: tecken90@gmail.com
{code}

h4. Root Cause:
Default Service Desk permission didn't add Service Desk Customer to the Add Comment permission in the permission scheme. 

h4. Workaround:
Add Service Desk Customer into the Add Comment permission in the project's permission scheme
fields.summary: Comment can't be added for Service Desk Customers via email due to lack of Add Comment permission by default

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. *Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create an user with an uppercase character in the user name.
# Log in with the new user.
# Create a Service Desk request.

h4. *Expected Results:*
Service Desk sends a notification for the user as usual.

h4. *Actual Results:*
Service Desk does not send any notifications for the reporter.

Same problem happens for users with "special" characters, like '.' or '@'
fields.summary: Notifications do not work for users with uppercase or special characters in the username

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-484].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When providing technical support within an internal technical support environment (such as Desktop support), it is useful to be able to collect an end-user's IP address to allow for quick remote debugging sessions with a Service Desk customer. As service desk customers may not have the technical knowledge to manually gather this information, being able to collect this though JIRA service desk would be a useful addition. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Collect the IP address of the customer as a special custom field and include it in the request.
fields.summary: Ability to capture IP information when creating issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-466].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The custom templates used for the service desk don't seem to play nice with the mail handler to strip quotes on response via email.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 2.5.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue from email or customer portal 
# Notification is send to the customer mail.
# Then , customer send multiple comment through email.

h3. Expected Results
All previous comment doesn’t include in the latest comment.

h3. Actual Results
Latest comment in the issue ticket include with all previous comment.

h3. Notes
Method one from this link needs to be done in the service desk template, I believe it is in the regular JIRA templates in the same way:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Strip+the+Old+Reply+Data+from+Email+When+Using+Outlook

{panel:title=shipped 2.6.0-OD-06}
Hi Guys,

This will be available in the next release 2.6.0-OD-06.
*Supported languages*
(English, French, German, Spanish, and Japanese). 

*Supported clients*
Desktop Email Clients
* Apple Mail
* IBM Lotus Notes
* Microsoft Outlook
* Thunderbird

Web-bases Email Clients
* Gmail.com
* Outlook.com
* Yahoo.com

Mobile Email Clients
* iPhone Mail app
* iPad Mail app
* Android Gmail app

*Supported patterns*
The below list is based on analyzing reply and forward emails in different languages (English, French, German, Spanish, and Japanese) using the clients above. If a block of text looks like any of the below pattern, then it is the start of a quoted email. However, we won't be able to detect quoted email if the mail client does not use any of the patterns below.
Note: if user accidentally writes some text that is similar below quoted texts, the email body will be cut from that text point.


{noformat}

On date, someone wrote
On Tue, Jun 9, 2015 at 5:33 PM, Admin <test@gmail.com> wrote:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove

On date, wrote someone
Am 11. Juni 2015 um 10:23 schrieb Admin <test@gmail.com>:

> Ver ver weg, achter het woord bergen, ver van de landen Vokalia en
> Consonantia, daar leven de blinde teksten. Gescheiden leven ze in
> Bookmarksgrove
Original Message
----- Original Message -----
>From: Admin <test@example.com>
>To: "knguyenjp@yahoo.co.jp" <knguyenjp@yahoo.co.jp> 
>Date: 2015/6/12, Fri 10:49
Forwarded Message
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject:   Fwd: Thunderbird 31 hello 2
Date:  Thu, 11 Jun 2015 10:21:07 +0700
Begin forwarded message
> Begin forwarded message:
>
> From: Admin <test@example.com>
> Subject: [jira@localhost] [DEVONE] request 2004 [DEV-72]
> Date: June 10, 2015 at 2:27:01 PM GMT+7
Sent from my iPhone/iPad
Sent from my iPhone/iPad

> On 22-06-2015, at 14:58, Admin <test@example.com> wrote:
>
> hello
Date, someone:
2015-06-11 14:04 GMT+07:00 Admin <test@example.com>:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean.

{noformat}
{panel}
fields.summary: Email Response Stripping

then try to create a new issue from added request type.

We need to fix this asap for our customer so let me know if my workaround is fine.

Hi,

We're using Confluence 5.4.3 with Jira 6.1.6 and Service Desk 1.2.1.

In the edit issue view in Jira, the "Create KB article" button shows up inconsistently - some issues have it, some don't.  

They're all in the same Service desk enabled project, of the same issue types, and there seems no obvious pattern about when they were created/edited/resolved.

Please see attached screenshots of two virtually identical issues - one that displays, the other that doesn't.

Thanks,

fields.description:
There are customers whose help desk close the issue immediately after creation (e.g. while taking a phone call for activating an account or resetting a password).
In such cases, they might use workflows which create the issue on the *Resolved* status so that they can close the issue upon its creation. However, the SLA *Time to Resolution* is not working for issues closed on creation.

*Steps to replicate:*
# Create a new Service Desk.
# Create a new workflow so that the issue is created with the Resolved status and associate it to an issue type in the Service Desk project.
# Change the SLA _Time to resolution_  as follows:
#* Time is stopped when _Entered Status: Resolved_.
#* Remove the _Resolution: Set_ condition.
# Create a new issue so that it is on the Resolved status after creation.
# The SLA field is still counting even though the status is _Resolved_.

*Expected behaviour:*
The SLA for the _Time to resolution_ should stop counting, as the condition configured has been met.
fields.summary: Setting SLA Time to resolution Upon Issue Creation does not Work

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-451].
  {panel}

h4. Use case
We have deployed JIRA Service Desk and we have three queues created such as:
Level 1 Global, Level 2 Global and Level 3 Global, our IT Staff are located in each country around the world and we would like an additional queue called Level 2 Local Support.
Use Case,
A London based IT staff has picked up an issue from the Level 1 Global queue and discovered a Jordan based IT staff would need to visit the user in person, the London based IT staff would reassign to Level 2 Local Support.
Therefore rather than creating a queue per country, we would like the currentuser() logged in to view tickets in the Level 2 Local queue tagged with his/her country parameter.

h4. Example
The JQL query must compare issues custom fields values against the users parameters i.e. country.
For Example, if a user named John Smith located at Nigeria logged into to the Local Queue, he should only see issues where location of the reporter is equal to the same country Parameter as the user i.e. Nigeria.
The same applies for others users located in Jordan, only showing issues logged by Jordan users based on the Current Users parameters.
fields.summary: Create filters against additional parameters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-446].
  {panel}

For a project which is associated with ServiceDesk, if a user creates a Service Desk Request (through the Customer Portal), then notifications are sent correctly according to [JSD-323|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-323].

However, if an issue is created normally by clicking on Create Issue button (same project) or via email through a mail handler (same project, no matter Default Reporter or recognized user), then the Reporter does not receive any notifications at all, including Issue Creation, Issue Updated, Issue Commented, and Issue Resolved.
(!) *This does not happen when ServiceDesk is disabled*, hence ServiceDesk must have affected JIRA notifications in an unexpected manner.

Please take note that in all of the above situations, Notify me is On for the Reporter all the times. This raises a question with the way ServiceDesk handles notifications to Reporters: even though they *purposely* want to receive notifications for their own changes, they can't.
fields.summary: Reporter does not receive notifications when creating issues without using ServiceDesk customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms

User emails into a create mail handler. Issue does not get created. Project for the mail handler has a Service Desk installed and is using Service Desk to manage the permission scheme.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new SD and project at the same time
# Remove jira-users from the Service Desk Team role in the People tab of Service Desk
# Set up a mail handler to create issues in the newly created project
# Put a valid email into watched mail box

h3. Expected result

Email is converted into a ticket.

I believe that this is caused by the changes made in: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-62

h3. Workaround

Add the jira-users group the Create Issue permission in the permission scheme. 
(i) Caveat for this is that the user will now be able to create issues into that project via the JIRA UI.
fields.summary: User needs Service Desk Team role membership to create issue via email

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-443].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+

When you get article results on the Customer Portal of service desk, its showing some of the helper/boilerplate text of the template that only shows when you're editing the Confluence page (but not when you view the page).

h4. +Steps to reproduce+

# Link a JIRA Service Desk project with a Confluence Knowledge Base
# Create a new page in the Knowledge Base, using the "How-to" article template
# Add some dummy text to the article, but don't delete all of the helper text
# Save the article
# Visit the Customer Portal and search for the article just created

h4. +Expected behavior+
Only the title and visible content of the page is shown

h4. +Actual behavior+
The hidden helper text is also shown

h4. +Note+
This still happens in JIRA 7.2.4, SD 3.2.4, and Confluence 6.0.1:
!editmode.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Helper text from article in Confluence Knowledge Base showing up in Service Desk article results

Client detail: https://olivetree-solutions.atlassian.net
We have a created Mail Handler for 'Support' and since few hours it has stopped bringing new emails sent to a pre-set support ID as a ticket in JIRA.

Please resolve this ASAP.

Used Host: pop.gmail.com
Protocol: Secure_Pop
Port: 995

(as work around right now I have added a separate connection with IMAP). And so on Gmail settings side have disabled POP.

Let me know once the POP connection is found working fine when you test it.
fields.summary: POP/IMAP Mail Servers and Mail Handlers not working.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our JSD license expired and JIRA had to run for about 6 hours before we entered the new license. The Issues that were transitioned during this time show some irrational behavior. We have a specific JIRA Issue that was resolved during this time that shows what is wrong. Let me explain:

We have 3 SLA metrics. 2 of them were still running when JSD went offline. First of the two was supposed to end (as succeeded) and the second was supposed to pause when we resolved the issue. When JSD came back we saw that the metric for the first one completely disappeared from the issue and the second one is still running. So us resolving the issue had no effect.

We tried to make minor changes on SLA definitions and re-calculate SLA's. No luck. 2 metrics are still wrong on that issue.

This is somewhat similar to JSD-55, the underlying root cause might be the same but causes trouble in a different (and more annoying) way.
fields.summary: SLA metrics disappear on Issues when Service Desk is off

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-428].
  {panel}

Users submitting through the portal may overlook articles, or not understand articles that require more technical knowledge.

It would be a huge value to allow agents to see by default any KB articles that match up to the summary (or description <-- too greedy?) of the currently viewed issue.

Even an extra click for performance reasons would be ok "Find related KB".

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/277880/view-related-confluence-kb-articles-on-existing-jira-service-desk-tickets
fields.summary: As an Agent I would like to see related KB articles on existing tickets so that I may more quickly resolve issues.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-426].
  {panel}

For our clients using service desk, they are hitting an issue when trying to reset their password. Here are the steps:

* Customer goes to the login screen.
* Customer clicks on "Forgot Password"
* Customer enters their username.
* Customer receives the email with the rest link.
* Customer clicks the link and goes to the reset password page.
* Customer enters in password, hits submit.

Normally, a user is then redirected to the login page. However, our client users (which have much more limited permissions) just see the password reset page refresh. If they know enough to go to the login page, the new password submission does work. However, to the end user, it appears that nothing happened and they click the submit button a second time. This throws an error "The reset password token you have provided has timed out".

We believe this is a bug, but it could be a simple matter of fixing a permission. Still, we would expect (given the password does reset) that the redirect should proceed.
fields.summary: Reset password is successful, but doesn't redirect the user to the login screen.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center
